1. The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which comprises audio means, converting means, and protocol means to handle and control communication of received and transmission data in accordance with a standardized Internet/network protocol. The terminal further comprises wireless communications means for wireless near field communication of received and/or transmission data in a wireless data format with a connecting unit adapted to establish a connection to a network and/or the Internet.
2. The system for Internet telephony comprises a portable communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server connected to the Internet and/or a network, which can handle and control the connection between a large number of users and provide additional services and functionalities such as news, reading of mails, speech mails, commercials, music, stock exchange and financial news, etc.

1. The invention is a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, which involves growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate. This buffer layer is used to prevent the diffusion of Pb and Bi into the substrate. The buffer layer is preferably less than about 10 nm thick.

2. A germanium layer is epitaxially grown on the semiconductor substrate, and the buffer layer is grown on the germanium layer. This provides a good buffer layer that is compatible with Si and many oxides. The epitaxial growth of Ge on top of the ferroelectric or high-dielectric constant oxide is also much easier than Si.

3. The Ge buffer layer can be used to prevent or minimize the formation of a low dielectric constant layer at the Si/oxide interface. This layer is generally amorphous and has a low dielectric constant, which degrades the usefulness of non-SiO2-based oxides with Si. The Ge buffer layer also enhances the epitaxy and reduces the reaction layer between the deposited oxide and the substrate.

4. The epitaxial growth of Ge on Si is compatible with current Si process technology, but the main difficulty is the 4% lattice mismatch, which results in misfit dislocations on Ge films thicker than 1 nm. A thin Ge layer is preferably used on the silicon to avoid misfit dislocations. Polycrystalline Ge may also be formed over polycrystalline Si.

5. The choice of materials may be very different depending on the application. For large density capacitors, (Ba1-x,Srx)TiO3 (BST) is the best linear dielectric. BaTiO3 (BT) or SrTiO3 (ST) are not thermodynamically stable next to Si, but they are stable next to Ge.

6. Not all oxides are stable next to Ge. For example, all ferroelectrics containing Pb, such as Pb(Ti,Zr)O3 (PZT), are much less stable next to Ge. A thin layer of SrTiO3 or other stable ferroelectric can be used as a buffer layer between the Pb-containing ferroelectric and the Ge-coated Si substrate.

7. The SrTiO3 buffer layer not only acts as a chemical barrier but also nucleates the desired perovskite structure. This is important because Pb is very reactive and can

<summary>
1. The invention aims to provide a receiver input circuit that eliminates undesired signal actuation of non-linear components, resulting in distortions, while maintaining adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components.
2. The circuit according to the invention uses three amplification control loops with different response thresholds and frequency band widths to control amplification and protect the circuit from overloading and signal distortions.

<summary>

1. The invention relates to network implemented shared workspace environments, specifically an apparatus and method for spontaneously setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals. This environment allows for enhanced communication between users via their desktop computers.

2. The invention aims to simplify the setup process of collaborative sessions, which is often cumbersome and time-consuming with current technology. It enables users to initiate a collaborative work-share environment without complex setup processes.

3. The system consists of a telephone and a desktop PC connected to a LAN, with a collaboration control program running on each PC. The program communicates with the phone to control the collaborate indicator and sense actuation of the collaborate button.

4. The collaboration control program has the capability of launching a collaboration application program or bringing it to the foreground. It also communicates with remote PCs via the LAN to request or respond to a list of collaboration application programs.

5. The system uses a call control unit to implement various telephony applications, including call setup and progress tone generation. The unit includes a plurality of Phone Proxies, each associated with a registered telephone.

6. When a call is completed, the Phone Proxy notifies the collaboration control program of the IP address of the remote PC and requests its IP address. The collaboration control program then compares its list of supported application programs with those supported by the remote PC.

7. If the parties share a collaboration application program supporting at least one protocol in common, the collaborate indicator is illuminated. The indicator remains illuminated as long as at least one other party remains in the call with the capability to collaborate.

8. The collaborate button takes no action unless the collaborate indicator is lit, at which point it launches or brings the collaboration application to the foreground. If multiple collaboration application programs are available, a dialog box is displayed listing the available applications.

9. The system can be implemented in various ways, including using separate connections from the phone to the LAN and the PC to the LAN, or using a one-wire-to-the-desktop configuration. The collaborate indicator and button can also be implemented on the PC.

10. The system can be applied in a peer-to-peer architecture, employing H.323 protocol, or in a system with dedicated telephone transport. The invention can be implemented on top of dedicated telephone systems, with data systems to connect the telephone and PC at the desktop.

11. The present invention can be implemented by remote computers connected over a network, and the telephone equipment can be integrated within the computer. The voice capability of the telephone can be provided by a microphone input into the computer.

12

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a method for processing pictures intended to insert an advertising clip at a point in a sequence of video pictures, which involves generating a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point and determining a degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of the advertising clip.
2. The advertising clip having the highest degree of similarity is then selected and inserted into the video sequence at the insertion point, resulting in an enhanced video sequence with improved visual impact.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to a recessed mask structure used in semiconductor devices to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections, resulting in lower electrical breakdown. This structure is particularly useful in high-speed and high-density integrated circuit applications with fine metal features and low dielectric constant insulators.

2. As semiconductor devices are miniaturized, dimensional tolerances become very small, and abrupt physical discontinuities produce high electrical fields that lead to enhanced leakage and breakdown. The use of different materials with lower dielectric constants is becoming more attractive for reducing device parameters such as line-to-line capacitance and cross-talk noise.

3. The invention provides a metal plus low dielectric constant (low-k) interconnect structure with reduced lateral leakage current and a lower effective dielectric constant than conventional structures. This is achieved by positioning a differentiating or mask member below the surface to be planarized, where there will be a lower electric field.

4. The recessed mask structure is particularly useful in damascene type device structures, where adjacent conductors are lined with an electrically conductive and diffusion barrier film, and connections are made to levels above and below through metal-filled vias. The structure also includes a dielectric cap applied over the surfaces of the metal lines and the masking layer.

5. The invention involves removing a portion of the mask layer to create a recessed surface, which is then positioned so that the high field points are separated from the interface between the mask and the cap. This allows for a lower and predictable overall capacitance, which is valuable for faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.

6. The structure of the invention can be made using a standard substrate with a bulk layer of intralevel dielectric material, and the etched openings are provided with conductive diffusion barrier liners. The surface is then chemically-mechanically polished until the copper conductors are nearly coplanar with the mask surface, and a different slurry is used to remove any remaining liner material.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down-converting A/D converter, eliminating the use of discrete-time analog circuitry and greatly reducing the complexity of the converter design.
2. The predictive loop filter is implemented using digital signal processing (DSP) techniques, allowing for the placement of the sampler inside the predictive loop and the re-mapping of the output of the predictive loop filter into the analog domain using a D/A converter.
3. The invention includes an offset nulling digital signal processing element that estimates the offsets introduced by the various circuits and provides a correction signal to the digital summing element.
4. The dynamic range performance of the digital predictive encoder is further extended by utilizing the digital output of the loop to generate the signal for controlling a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer to form a sensor device or a matrix of devices for multiplex detection of selected analytes.
2. The method uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as sensors or for multiplex detection of analytes.
3. The fabrication process involves depositing a semiconducting active layer over the entire wafer and patterning it into a set of parallel nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography.
4. The nanotraces are perpendicular to the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes and provide a narrow electrical bridge between them.
5. The fabrication of a set of parallel nanotraces serves to homogenize the total response to changes in local environment, such as gas phase, solution environment, or solid environment.
6. The method also involves depositing a gate electrode and gate dielectric layer, and patterning the source and drain electrodes.
7. The final device is prepared for microfluidic coupling by depositing an oxide protection layer and a photoepoxy resist layer, which serves as the bonding face for a microfluidic cover plate.
8. The multiplex detection array is packaged onto an electronics board and can be used to detect target molecules by measuring changes in electrical current through the semiconductor nanotraces.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a singulation and plating method for semiconductor packages, which involves plating the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
2. The method includes providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material.
3. The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, and can be a metallic material such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
4. The singulation process can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting, and the plating process can be performed before or after the singulation process.
5. The present invention also provides a singulated semiconductor package comprising a leadframe, a semiconductor die, and a molding compound, where the side surfaces of the leads are exposed and plated with a plating material.
6. The side surfaces of the semiconductor package can have a step or beveled portion, and can be formed using a variety of cutting blades and techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention provides a method and system for a mobile terminal to switch from a wireless local area network (WLAN) to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) in time to avoid dropping or delaying connections.
2. The mobile terminal receives service information from a second base station in the WLAN, which includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of the first base stations in the WWAN.
3. The mobile terminal uses the service information to select a serving base station from the first base stations and connects to the WWAN, skipping some initial scanning procedures.
4. If the mobile terminal fails to connect to the serving base station, it can scan the frequency channels using the service information or start an all channels scanning procedure.

<summary>
1. The invention relates to the production of multilayered components, particularly multilayered electrical components, and provides a new process that simplifies the manufacture of such components. This process eliminates the need for cutting and metallizing steps, which are the most costly from a labor standpoint.

2. The process involves providing a first electrode and a first electrical component, locating the electrode in a recess formed by the component to produce a first laminate sub-assembly, and repeating this process to produce multiple sub-assemblies. These sub-assemblies are then brought into mutually stacked relation to form a resultant assembly.

3. The process also includes the provision of methods to interconnect electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies, locate sub-assemblies in precise registered relation, and build-up stacks with covering components at upper and lower ends of the stacks. This allows for the fabrication of assemblies of many different sizes at very low cost and at high production rates.

4. The invention provides apparatus or tooling to enable such fabrication, and the resultant sub-assemblies and assemblies themselves. The process also enables the inspection of both the electrode print and dielectric print for perfection and thickness before commitment to actual construction.

5. The new process allows for the use of thinner dielectric because of the electrode/dielectric configuration, making possible the provision of a 25-volt capacitor designed to take advantage of the lower voltage. This results in four times the capacitance for a given volume, or less than half the precious electrode material required, for the same capacitance.

6. The elimination of the cutting operation also enables the production of a more reliable part for high reliability requirements, as it eliminates the presence of small micro cracks that can be detected on the cover plate surfaces adjacent to the silvered ends of the capacitors. This results in a more reliable part with no shape limitations, lower voltage ratings, and lower labor content per part.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically to materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices and related methods of using and manufacturing the same. The invention was made with United States Government support under Grant No. N00014-07-1-0114, awarded by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency/Office of Naval Research.

2. The invention provides a hierarchical lattice structure that comprises unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength. The unit cells can be of different shapes, such as tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, or three-dimensional Kagome.

3. The unit cells can be comprised of multiple cell sizes, with larger cells referred to as being of a higher order than smaller cells. The order of a cell corresponds to its size in relation to other cells, where size is measured by the length of a cell's ligaments.

4. The materials for manufacturing these unit cells encompass any material subject to deformation, punch and die, casting, injection molding, or other forming methods, including metals, metal alloys, inorganic polymers, organic polymers, ceramics, glasses, and all composite derivatives.

5. The unit cells can be connected together to form a primary array, with the primary array comprising an array of first order cells. The primary array can be formed by joining ligaments of adjacent cells together at nodes.

6. An ancillary array can be nested with the primary array, with the ancillary array comprising an array of second order cells. The ancillary array can be nested with the primary array when a portion of a ligament of a higher order cell of a primary array abuts a ligament of a lower order cell of an ancillary array.

7. The lattice structure can be mated with an oppositely oriented lattice structure to form a mated lattice structure. Mating is accomplished when at least one ligament of at least one of the highest order cells of an array or lattice structure abuts with at least a substantial portion of at least one ligament of at least one of the highest order cells of an oppositely oriented lattice structure or array.

8. The lattice structures can be used as the cores of sandwich panel structures, with the sandwich panels having ultra-light and high specific stiffness and strength lattice cores. The sandwich panels can be used in minimum weight structural applications, including many forms of mechanized transportation.

9. The lattice structures can also be used to construct materials with improved impact or

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, which includes a wet gasification stage and a dry gasification stage. The wet gasification stage produces a combustion gas with a high hydrogen content, while the dry gasification stage produces a synthesis gas precursor with a lower hydrogen content. The combustion gas is enriched with hydrogen to increase the H2/CO molar ratio.

2. The process also includes a CTL facility that converts the synthesis gas to hydrocarbons using Fischer-Tropsch synthesis. The CTL facility produces a Fischer-Tropsch tail gas that is treated to remove CO2 and water, and the resulting hydrogen is recycled to the Fischer-Tropsch synthesis stage. The CTL facility also produces a fuel gas that is used to generate power in the IGCC facility.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, with a focus on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface. This is achieved by providing a blocking film, or passivation film, to prevent the removal of oxygen from that surface.

2. The blocking film is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material using a photo CVD method, which is a method of exciting a reactive gas using ultraviolet light for coating a film onto a film forming surface. The film is formed at a thickness of 10 Å to 2μm.

3. The superconducting material used in the present invention can be in the form of tablets or thin films, and can be made of various materials such as (YBa2)Cu3O6-8. The material is placed in a vacuum, causing the oxygen in the area close to the surface to be removed, resulting in a deterioration of electrical characteristics.

4. To prevent the removal of oxygen, a film such as silicon nitride, silicon oxide, or aluminum is formed on the surface of the material using the CVD method. The film is formed at a depth of 5 Å to 50 Å, and is used to coat the inside of the spaces or micro-holes.

5. The film is then subjected to heat treatment in an atmosphere of oxygen at 300° C. to 900° C. to position the added oxygen in the appropriate atom location and to convert the film to a highly dense insulating material. This process results in a highly reliable device with no oxygen deficiency in the surface portion.
</summary>

2. The apparatus enables the preparation of foam samples with parallel cut edges, preserving the structure of individual cells within the sample for examination without distortion or mutilation.

<summary>

1. The invention relates to seismometers, especially those designed to operate on the ocean floor, and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by such a unit during its operation. This is particularly important for ocean bottom seismometers (OBS) used in oil and natural gas exploration. The OBS is designed to operate remotely on the ocean floor, and its position and orientation can affect the quality of seismic data collected. The invention aims to provide a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination.

2. The present invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed in a seismometer. Seismic motion detectors, such as geophones, are commercially available and are used to sense the component of motion occurring along an axis parallel to their operating axis. To fully sense all components of seismic motion, three orthogonally positioned detectors are needed. The invention provides a means to align the vertically and horizontally operating detectors parallel and perpendicular to the vertical, respectively.

3. The invention uses a free-moving pendulum to automatically align the seismic motion detector with respect to the vertical. The pendulum consists of a geophone, a shaft, and a spherical ball, which are supported in an annular seat. The geophone is connected to the end of the shaft, and the shaft is protruding from the spherical ball. The spherical ball rests in the annular seat, allowing the geophone to swing freely.

4. The invention also includes a plunger that is used to lock the pendulum in place. The plunger is positioned above the spherical ball and is restrained from contact with its surface by a pin. The pin is connected to a linearly acting solenoid, which is used to remove the pin and allow the plunger to extend and lock the pendulum in place. The plunger is designed to be cocked for operation before deployment.

5. The operation of the invention involves deploying the seismometer carrying the invention and allowing the pendulum to swing freely. The line passing through the center of gravity of the geophone and the center of the spherical ball is immediately and automatically aligned with respect to the vertical. The geophone is then positioned for proper operation. After the seismometer has stabilized, an electric current is introduced to activate the solenoid, removing the pin and allowing the plunger to lock the pendulum in place.

6. The invention provides a means to determine the angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer

<summary>
1. The present invention provides a relative humidity sensing element that is energized by low voltage microscopic currents from solid state electronic instrumentation, does not depend on mechanical movements, and is physically sturdy and requires no special physical protection. It is also non-hygroscopic, unaffected by fingerprints or dirty environments, and has a response time of one second. The element is manufactured by a novel combination of familiar and non-exotic manufacturing methods. It is suitable for excitation by a ten Hertz sine wave alternating current electrical voltage impressed across its electrodes.

2. The humidity sensing element of the preferred embodiment consists of a tubular aluminum first electrode member whose bore has been anodized, the anodized layer impregnated in its porosity with nickel particles by vacuum deposition, the anodized layer sealed, and the sealed anodized layer overlaid with a porous vacuum deposition of nickel to form a second electrode. The sensing element is typically a small, hollow cylinder of commercially pure aluminum, with a bore of about 15 millimeter diameter, 32 millimeter length, and a wall thickness of about 15 millimeters. The anodized layer is formed by oxalic acid anodizing on a portion of the sensing element having an initial surface finish roughness of about 8 micro inches root means square. The second electrode is formed by vacuum deposition of nickel onto the sealed anodized coating.

3. The exact means by which the sensor of this invention functions to have an impedance which decreases generally linearly proportionally to the relative humidity of the atmosphere to which it is exposed must be a subject for theorizing. However, the invention of the present sensor was based on the theory that a suitable combination of capacitance and resistance in a humidity sensing element should result in a humidity element which responds essentially linearly proportionally to the relative humidity of the atmosphere to which it is exposed. The sensor's impedance varies inversely proportionally to the relative humidity of the atmosphere, and when connected in series with a resistance and excited by a suitable alternating current voltage, the voltage drop across the series resistor will vary directly as the relative humidity of the atmosphere. The sensor's impedance changes almost instantly in response to relative humidity changes due to the thin and molecularly porous dielectric and second electrode.

1. The invention relates to a motor assembly, specifically a motor assembly having a force transmission structure. The force transmission structure comprises a drive plate and a shaft. The drive plate is connected to the output shaft of the motor via a gear train.

2. Conventionally, the shaft is coupled to the drive plate via a cylindrical coupling end with two flat surfaces at opposite sides thereof fittingly received in a waist-shaped hole of the drive plate. This design generates impact on the shaft and the drive plate to thereby generate vibration and noise. As such, there is a desire for an improved transition structure.

3. The present invention provides a force transmission structure comprising a drive plate having a mounting hole and a shaft fitted to the mounting hole for rotation with the drive plate. The mounting hole has at least three sections interconnected with one another at a common area. The shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole.

4. The drive plate preferably comprises a body and a coupling formed at the center of the body, the coupling is deeper than the body in the axial direction of the body, the mounting hole being formed in the coupling. The coupling has buffer holes respectively located between adjacent sections. The drive plate has a plurality of protrusions formed on a first side of the body.

5. The shaft further comprises a pinion configured to drive a driven member. The drive plate further comprises a plurality of ribs formed at an opposite second side of the body. The mounting hole and the toothed portion are Y-shaped.

6. The present invention also provides a motor assembly comprising a motor, a force transmission structure comprising a drive plate and a shaft, and a gear train connecting the motor to the drive plate for driving the drive plate. The drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected with one another at a common area. The shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole of the drive plate.

7. The gear train preferably comprises a worm driven by the motor, a worm gear meshed with the worm, and a damper attached to and rotatable with the worm gear. The drive plate is driven by the worm gear through the damper. The worm comprises an inner ring, an outer ring, and a plurality of ribs extending from the inner ring to the outer ring.

8. The damper is made of rubber material, has a through opening at the center thereof and has a plurality of first slots and second slots

<summary>
1. The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver in wireless communication systems, particularly in wideband code division multiple access (WCDMA) systems. This mobile time reference is used for detection, identification, and monitoring of multipath signals.
2. The system includes a free running counter (FRC) that generates the mobile time reference using a high frequency clock and maintains it using a low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available. The FRC operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz or 32 KHz, depending on whether the portable transceiver is in active mode or idle mode.
3. The mobile time reference is used by the WCDMA modem to create a timing reference for the portable transceiver system and for acquiring the parameters required to recover the multipath signals and operate a multipath signal receiver. This improves the efficiency of detecting, identifying, and monitoring the incoming multipath signals.
